item.title: Dominican Republic
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Dominican Republic

The Dominican Republic, nestled in the heart of the Caribbean, enchants visitors with its diverse landscapes, from stunning beaches to lush mountains. Boasting a rich cultural tapestry, it invites exploration of historic colonial cities like Santo Domingo, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This vibrant nation pulsates with music, dance, and flavorsome cuisine, offering a delightful fusion of African, Spanish, and Taíno influences. Travelers can relish its breathtaking coastline, indulge in water sports, explore verdant national parks, and immerse themselves in the warmth of its people. The Dominican Republic promises an unforgettable blend of relaxation, adventure, and cultural immersion in a captivating tropical paradise.

item.title: Puerto Plata
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Puerto Plata

Puerto Plata, nestled on the northern coast of the Dominican Republic, exudes an enchanting blend of history, natural beauty, and vibrant Caribbean culture. This coastal city beckons travelers with its golden beaches bathed in sunshine and framed by majestic mountain vistas. Visitors revel in its rich historical heritage, exploring the iconic Fortaleza San Felipe, a 16th-century Spanish fortress overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. Puerto Plata boasts the only cable car in the Caribbean, whisking adventurers to the pinnacle of Mount Isabel de Torres for panoramic views and the famous Christ the Redeemer statue.
The region's lush landscapes provide opportunities for eco-adventures, from hiking amidst tropical forests to exploring hidden waterfalls like the Damajagua Cascades. Immerse yourself in the local rhythm with merengue music and authentic Dominican cuisine in the vibrant city center. Puerto Plata seamlessly blends history, natural wonders, and cultural vibrancy, promising an enriching and captivating experience in the Dominican Republic.

item.title: Santo Domingo
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Santo Domingo

Santo Domingo, the capital city of the Dominican Republic, stands as a living testament to the country's rich history and vibrant culture. As the oldest continuously inhabited European settlement in the Americas, Santo Domingo boasts a UNESCO-listed Colonial Zone, where cobbled streets and centuries-old buildings, including the iconic Cathedral of Santa María la Menor, offer a glimpse into its colonial past. Visitors can explore significant historical sites like the Alcázar de Colón, former residence of the Columbus family, and the Ozama Fortress.
Beyond its historical allure, Santo Domingo pulsates with a dynamic energy seen in its lively nightlife, diverse culinary scene, and bustling markets. The Malecón, a scenic oceanfront boulevard, invites leisurely strolls along the Caribbean Sea. Art galleries, museums, and cultural events showcase the city's artistic prowess and contemporary influences. Santo Domingo's fusion of heritage and modernity creates an immersive and captivating experience for travelers exploring the heart of the Dominican Republic.

Beyond its historical allure, Santo Domingo pulsates with a dynamic energy seen in its lively nightlife, diverse culinary scene, and bustling markets. The Malecón, a scenic oceanfront boulevard, invites leisurely strolls along the Caribbean Sea. Art galleries, museums, and cultural events showcase the city's artistic prowess and contemporary influences. Santo Domingo's fusion of heritage and modernity creates an immersive and captivating experience for travelers exploring the heart of the Dominican Republic.

Santo Domingo

item.title: Medelin
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Medellin

Nevada, constituent state of the United States of America. It borders Oregon and Idaho to the north, Utah to the east, Arizona to the southeast, and California to the west. It ranks seventh among the 50 U.S. states in terms of total area. It also, however, is one of the most sparsely settled. Carson City, in the western part of the state, is the capital. Nevada became the 36th state of the union on October 31, 1864.

Medellin

item.title: Bogota
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Bogota

New Jersey, constituent state of the United States of America. One of the original 13 states, it is bounded by New York to the north and northeast, the Atlantic Ocean to the east and south, and Delaware and Pennsylvania to the west. The state was named for the island of Jersey in the English Channel. The capital is Trenton.

Although it has major social, economic, and political force in its own right, New Jersey is sometimes looked upon as a stepchild among the heavily industrialized and populated states along the Eastern Seaboard. New Jersey is one of the smallest states in area, but it is highly urbanized and has one of the country’s highest population densities. Hundreds of thousands of its citizens commute to New York and Pennsylvania. New Jersey’s transportation system is one of the busiest and most extensive in the world, and it weaves the state into the fabric of the region by funneling goods and people to New York City and other points north and to Philadelphia and points south. For hundreds of thousands of visitors it offers long stretches of fine beaches along the Atlantic Ocean, and the resort town of Atlantic City may be better known than the state itself

Bogota

Bogota

New Jersey, constituent state of the United States of America. One of the original 13 states, it is bounded by New York to the north and northeast, the Atlantic Ocean to the east and south, and Delaware and Pennsylvania to the west. The state was named for the island of Jersey in the English Channel. The capital is Trenton.

Although it has major social, economic, and political force in its own right, New Jersey is sometimes looked upon as a stepchild among the heavily industrialized and populated states along the Eastern Seaboard. New Jersey is one of the smallest states in area, but it is highly urbanized and has one of the country’s highest population densities. Hundreds of thousands of its citizens commute to New York and Pennsylvania. New Jersey’s transportation system is one of the busiest and most extensive in the world, and it weaves the state into the fabric of the region by funneling goods and people to New York City and other points north and to Philadelphia and points south. For hundreds of thousands of visitors it offers long stretches of fine beaches along the Atlantic Ocean, and the resort town of Atlantic City may be better known than the state itself

Bogota

item.title: Punta Cana
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Punta Cana

Punta Cana, nestled along the eastern shores of the Dominican Republic, embodies the epitome of a tropical paradise. This coastal gem boasts an array of world-class, all-inclusive resorts sprawled along its powdery white sands and azure waters. Visitors indulge in the ultimate beach escape, where relaxation meets adventure. Punta Cana offers a myriad of activities, from snorkeling in vibrant coral reefs to adrenaline-pumping zip-lining adventures through lush forests.
Golf enthusiasts relish the challenge of championship golf courses set against breathtaking ocean views. For a glimpse into local culture, explore nearby towns or savor traditional Dominican cuisine at beachfront restaurants. Beyond its pristine beaches, Punta Cana showcases ecological wonders at sites like the Indigenous Eyes Ecological Park, home to hidden lagoons and diverse wildlife. Whether seeking serenity, thrilling escapades, or cultural immersion, Punta Cana promises an unforgettable Caribbean experience.

item.title: La Vega
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
La Vega

La Vega, nestled in the heart of the Dominican Republic, offers a captivating blend of cultural heritage and natural beauty. Famous for its vibrant Carnival celebrations, this city pulsates with music, dance, and colorful parades during February. Visitors can explore historic sites like the Cathedral of Our Lady of the Mercedes, showcasing colonial architecture and religious significance.
Nature enthusiasts will find solace in nearby attractions like the stunning Jimenoa Waterfalls and the verdant landscapes of Jarabacoa, ideal for hiking and river rafting adventures. The city's bustling markets and local cuisine, including the beloved "pastelitos," provide an authentic taste of Dominican culture. La Vega's charm lies in its fusion of traditions, where folklore, history, and breathtaking scenery converge, offering an immersive experience for travelers seeking a deeper connection with the Dominican Republic's cultural tapestry.

[elementor-element k="6c0ab081e425e1e4a3e16c038f05e232" data=""]

La Vega

La Vega, nestled in the heart of the Dominican Republic, offers a captivating blend of cultural heritage and natural beauty. Famous for its vibrant Carnival celebrations, this city pulsates with music, dance, and colorful parades during February. Visitors can explore historic sites like the Cathedral of Our Lady of the Mercedes, showcasing colonial architecture and religious significance.
Nature enthusiasts will find solace in nearby attractions like the stunning Jimenoa Waterfalls and the verdant landscapes of Jarabacoa, ideal for hiking and river rafting adventures. The city's bustling markets and local cuisine, including the beloved "pastelitos," provide an authentic taste of Dominican culture. La Vega's charm lies in its fusion of traditions, where folklore, history, and breathtaking scenery converge, offering an immersive experience for travelers seeking a deeper connection with the Dominican Republic's cultural tapestry.

United States

Justo, vel, quisque senectus malesuada amet. Faucibus amet id quam vitae massa sociis varius maecenas. Dui dis sit tincidunt et consequat scelerisque. Posuere vitae velit, adipiscing viverra tristique ornare. Venenatis sollicitudin sagittis, turpis est. Urna a velit purus ac vel volutpat eu eget. Libero, turpis pellentesque congue eget turpis nunc, enim, at non. Ut sagittis sed tempor non tincidunt elementum orci, fringilla. Scelerisque nunc ullamcorper elementum etiam pulvinar sit commodo placerat massa.

Dapibus tortor sagittis a mattis donec. Ut arcu tempor scelerisque lorem eget elementum. Tortor donec et purus scelerisque purus. Consectetur enim, suspendisse feugiat sapien iaculis nulla dictumst. Ac ut in lectus purus aliquam, ultrices. Sed enim diam fringilla sed gravida.

La Vega

La Vega, nestled in the heart of the Dominican Republic, offers a captivating blend of cultural heritage and natural beauty. Famous for its vibrant Carnival celebrations, this city pulsates with music, dance, and colorful parades during February. Visitors can explore historic sites like the Cathedral of Our Lady of the Mercedes, showcasing colonial architecture and religious significance.
Nature enthusiasts will find solace in nearby attractions like the stunning Jimenoa Waterfalls and the verdant landscapes of Jarabacoa, ideal for hiking and river rafting adventures. The city's bustling markets and local cuisine, including the beloved "pastelitos," provide an authentic taste of Dominican culture. La Vega's charm lies in its fusion of traditions, where folklore, history, and breathtaking scenery converge, offering an immersive experience for travelers seeking a deeper connection with the Dominican Republic's cultural tapestry.

La Vega

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Elvis Tours Privacy Policy

Last Updated: December 15th, 2023.

Elvis Tours ("us," "we," or "our") operates the website [www.elvistours.info] (the "Service"). This page informs you of our policies regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal data when you use our Service and the choices you have associated with that data.

We use your data to provide and improve the Service. By using the Service, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy.

Information Collection and Use

We collect several different types of information for various purposes to provide and improve our Service to you.

Types of Data Collected

Personal Data

While using our Service, we may ask you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information that can be used to contact or identify you ("Personal Data"). Personally identifiable information may include, but is not limited to:

- Email address
- First name and last name
- Phone number
- Address, State, Province, ZIP/Postal code, City
- Cookies and Usage Data

Usage Data

We may also collect information on how the Service is accessed and used ("Usage Data"). This Usage Data may include information such as your computer's Internet Protocol address (e.g., IP address), browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on those pages, unique device identifiers, and other diagnostic data.

Use of Data

Elvis Tours uses the collected data for various purposes:

- To provide and maintain our Service
- To notify you about changes to our Service
- To provide customer support
- To gather analysis or valuable information so that we can improve our Service
- To monitor the usage of our Service
- To detect, prevent and address technical issues
- To provide you with news, special offers, and general information about other goods, services, and events that we offer, similar to those you have already purchased or inquired about, unless you have opted not to receive such information

Data Retention

Elvis Tours will retain your Personal Data only for as long as is necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy. We will retain and use your Personal Data to the extent necessary to comply with our legal obligations (for example, if we are required to retain your data to comply with applicable laws), resolve disputes, and enforce our legal agreements and policies.

Security of Data

The security of your data is important to us, but remember that no method of transmission over the internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us:

- By email: [contacto@elvistours.info]
- By visiting this page on our website: [www.elvistours.info/contact]

Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.

You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes. Changes to this Privacy Policy are effective when they are posted on this page.

item.title: Contact Us
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Contact information

"Have questions or inquiries? Reach out to Elvis Tours! Contact us for tailored travel experiences and exceptional customer service."

Cuartel CESEP, Puerto Plata 57000, República

+1 (829) 947-9393

item.title: Exploring the Dominican Republic: Insider Tips for an Unforgettable Journey
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
The Dominican Republic is a treasure trove of stunning landscapes, vibrant culture, and warm hospitality that beckons travelers from across the globe. As a tour operator and travel agency rooted in this paradise, we're thrilled to share exclusive tips to ensure your Dominican adventure is nothing short of extraordinary.

1. Embrace the Diversity of Destinations:
Beyond the famed beaches, the Dominican Republic boasts diverse landscapes. Explore the lush greenery of Jarabacoa, hike to the Pico Duarte summit for breathtaking views, or uncover the historic charm of Santo Domingo's Colonial City. Each region holds its own unique allure.

2. Savour the Culinary Delights:
Indulge in the rich flavors of Dominican cuisine. Don't miss out on trying the delectable "mangu" (mashed plantains), fresh seafood at local beachside shacks, and the national dish, "la bandera" (the flag), consisting of rice, beans, and meat.

3. Immerse Yourself in Local Culture:
Engage with the vibrant culture by attending a traditional "merengue" or "bachata" dance class. Visit local markets, interact with artisans, and learn about the country's history at museums and historical sites like the Alcázar de Colón.

4. Opt for Responsible Tourism:
Respect the environment and local communities. Choose eco-friendly tours, support local businesses, and be mindful of your ecological footprint by participating in beach clean-ups or nature conservation projects.

5. Master Basic Spanish Phrases:
While many Dominicans speak English in tourist areas, learning a few Spanish phrases can enhance your experience and show appreciation for the local culture. Simple greetings like "hola" (hello) and "gracias" (thank you) go a long way.

 

6. Prioritize Safety and Health:
Stay hydrated, use sunscreen, and be cautious with food and drinks to avoid any health issues. Be vigilant with your belongings and prefer authorized taxis or reputable transport services.

7. Embrace the Pura Vida Lifestyle:
Embrace the laid-back "Pura Vida" lifestyle, characterized by relaxation and positivity. Slow down, unwind, and immerse yourself in the island's tranquil atmosphere.

8. Weather Awareness:
Be mindful of the weather conditions, especially during the hurricane season (June to November). Stay informed about local weather forecasts and plan activities accordingly.

9. Connect with Nature:
The Dominican Republic is a haven for nature lovers. Explore national parks like Los Haitises or El Choco, go whale watching at Samaná Bay, or dive into the crystal-clear waters for unforgettable snorkeling experiences.

10. Capture Timeless Memories:
Lastly, savor every moment and capture the beauty of the Dominican Republic through photographs, journals, or simply by being present. Cherish the memories that will last a lifetime.

Embark on your Dominican journey with these tips in mind, and let the charm of this Caribbean paradise captivate your heart and soul. Happy travels!

item.title: The Ultimate Cheat Sheet on Travel
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
If you’re a student who is planning on attending school abroad as part of your studies or you’re being relocated by your company, it can seem daunting to visit a new country for the first time. Looking for some tips and tricks to mastering international travel? We have them, courtesy of Travel + Leisure.

• Hotel business cards: You’ll most likely be spending time in a hotel, at least at first till you can find a more permanent place. Grab a business card from the front desk so if you ever get lost, you’ll have the name and address of the hotel in the local language.

• The six-month passport rule: The expiration date on your passport is deceiving. In the U.S., you can use your passport up to the date listed inside the cover. However, many other countries have been known to deny travelers entry if the passport expires in under six months. That’s because they want to ensure you have a valid passport to get back to the United States in case of travel snafus and unexpected issues. You should always renew your passport nine months before the actual expiration date.

• Credit cards: The best exchange rates are usually within your credit card. That being said, many credit cards will add foreign transaction fees of up to three percent. Do your research on credit cards that don’t have this fee before heading on your trip.

• Fraud alerts. Let your credit card company’s fraud department know the country you’ll be visiting and when. This will prevent them from thinking your card was stolen.

• Credit card chips: In the U.S., credit cards use magnetic strips on the back of the card or chips on the front. In Europe, cards have a chip embedded in them and this is largely the way transactions are conducted, along with a PIN. If your cards don’t already have this technology, seek out ones that do or upgrade your existing card.

• Medicine: Always carry an eye mask and earplugs in your medicine bag, along with pain relievers, antacids, prescriptions, contact lenses and solution, etc. You may not come across a 24-hour pharmacy overseas like you see on every other block in the U.S. Fill your prescriptions before you go.

• Travel alerts: Check the State Department’s travel warnings and alerts, and always print out the address and contact information of the local embassy.

• Charges and Adapters: When going overseas it’s crucial to have the right adapter for your devices. An USB universal power adapter can make your life easier, because you won’t have to figure out power outlets, wattage, and will allow you to charge multiples devices simultaneously. When it comes to charges it’s advisable to pack more than one to be on the safe side, according to our friends at One Bag Travel.

• Data roaming: To avoid international data roaming, go to settings and ensure it is disabled. Sign up for an international calling and data plan if you’ll be abroad for a while.

• Language learning: This one you have to prepare for before you go. Sign up for language lessons with BRIC Learning Systems to connect with tutors in their native countries. You’ll also find this invaluable when learning all about the culture!

item.title: The Best Kept Secrets About Travel
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
PENNSYLVANIA, USA — The difference between a tourist and a traveler is getting to know a culture, according to Karen Gershowitz, writer and travel addict.

Since boarding a plane to Europe when she was 17, Gershowitz has visited over 90 countries and "gained friends and lovers and made a radical career change," according to her website.

In this week's Travel Smart, FOX43's Trenice Bishop spoke to Gershowitz about how to find the "hidden secrets" of travel destinations. She said that travel is all about being open to new things and new experiences. 

Her number one travel tip is simply to talk to people. 

"Be friendly, smile at people, ask them questions, show that you're interested," she said.

Second, she said to plan a trip around something you love.

"It doesn't matter if it's sports, arts, or if it's food," Gershowitz said. "But whatever it is, go and do that and talk to the people who are around you because you'll mostly find locals and they know the really great places to go, and what to do, and the kinds of places to see."

Third, she said to pick up a paper and look for local events.

"Look for the festivals, rather than the places," she said. "That's where the people will be. They'll tell you whether the places in the guidebooks are worth going to."

Finally, she said to enjoy the journey and expect the unexpected. 

Karen Gershowitz is the author of Travel Mania - Stories of Wanderlust, a vivid story of how one woman found her strength, power, and passion.

item.title: How to Explain Travel to a Five-Year-Old
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
I’ve been a traveler my whole life — and was lucky enough to have a family that prioritized experiencing new destinations throughout my childhood. Now, it’s my nephew’s turn. At two years old, with seven countries down, he’s on his way to becoming a citizen of the world.

While traveling with a child at any age may seem like a daunting prospect, experts claim that it can significantly boost development. They say travel can expand a kid’s world, making them more empathetic toward cultural differences and helping them adapt to changing situations. It can even shape their linguistic development as babies.

“They're going to start learning the tools for developing meaningful relationships, especially across differences, from an early age,” Dr. Robin Hancock, a global education specialist with Bank Street College, told Travel + Leisure. “Travel has the potential to create a new narrative that teaches children about the similarities with others [and] lays a strong foundation, especially in the early years...We have the potential to raise a generation that knows how to live and coexist with each other.”

I’ve watched my nephew try beans for the first time at La Guarida in Havana, picking up and considering each individual one, almost as if testing it. I’ve seen him stick his feet in the Dead Sea (and then quickly pull them back out again), as well as try gelato under the shadow of the Duomo in Florence.

He may not remember these adventures, but they will impact his development, according to Hancock. The most rapid brain development occurs in the first five years of a child’s life, and especially in the first three, she said. Surrounding kids from birth to about three years old with people who are different than them “normalizes” that experience.

“Travel and educating children about their roles as citizens of the world when they’re young ensures they will retain that message into their adult years,” she said. “When somebody begins a habit or a tradition... early in life, that becomes the foundation through which they view the world for the rest of their life.”

Traveling with young children – even as young as six months old — can also help them with linguistic development, said Erika Levy, an associate professor in communication sciences and disorders at Teachers College at Columbia University.

“We know that in terms of language, babies perceive sounds differently from adults. As they get older... they lose the ability to distinguish many of the other speech sounds,” said Levy. “If we surround them with speech sounds from all around the world... then we are keeping those categories going, which helps later on in life with their language.”

And when they return home from a trip, their experiences can actually help them in school, according to Hancock.

“It makes them more open to try new things [and] less cautious of people and scenarios that are not familiar to them,” she said. “It will inevitably make children more open and remove bias.”

Here are a few tips on how to maximize your child’s experience while traveling.

Take a stroll in a local neighborhood.

While it’s great to see the major attractions in a destination, walking around a local neighborhood can be one of the most impactful moments for children, said Hancock. A child’s brain tends to make connections based on what is familiar to them. “If you're in Venice, spend time on the Grand Canal, and if you're in Paris, spend time by the Eiffel Tower, but the pieces that really resonate with children are the experiences they can relate to,” she said. “It’s going to be meaningful for your child if you just find a quiet neighborhood and go forwalk…Inevitably, you’re going to see people sweeping out their front yard and local vendors. And that's much more meaningful — you’re going to get a better slice of what everyday life is like and your child will, too.”

Create a tradition while on vacation.

Traditions can help kids connect to a trip. For example, as children, my sister and I collected soda bottles in every country we visited. “Traditions are meaningful for kids,” said Hancock. “Anything that you can relate back to the child's world is going to be a meaningful experience to them.”

Have your kids play with other children.

Grouping kids with other children around their age will help their development, even if they don’t speak the same language, according to Levy. “Have them meet other children — they will play, learn, and find ways to communicate,” she said. “And they’ll learn that not everybody speaks English.”

Turn your trip into a game.

Asking children to point out things that are new to them, Levy recommended “Have them show you three things they've never seen before at home.” She said, “You can do a treasure hunt for them.”

Prepare your children in advance.

Preparing children for what they’re about to experience can go a long way, according to Levy. For example, tell them in advance about jet lag, or if they’re nervous traveling, bring a special toy on the plane. But ultimately, you shouldn’t be too worried: Levy said that children tend to be “more adaptable than we are in new situations.”
item.excerpt:encoded: I’ve been a traveler my whole life — and was lucky enough to have a family that prioritized experiencing new destinations throughout my childhood. Now, it’s my nephew’s turn. At two years old, with seven countries down, he’s on his way to becoming a citizen of the world.

item.title: Tiptoe through the Tulips of Washington
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
2021 will be a Different Skagit Valley Tulip Festival. We know there will be restrictions on the number of people who can visit our fields and gardens (and other retail establishments/restaurants/venues) based on COVID guidelines established by the state and county governments. We will be following those guidelines, but still be working to welcome you and help you with your visit. Tulip Town has set its ticketing policy; you can find out more at https://tuliptown.com/pages/visit. RoozenGaarde has done so as well; find out more at https://roozengaarde.ticketspice.com/skagit-valley-tulip-festival-tickets.

This is event is geared towards visitors of all ages but if you happen to be traveling with a tot, here are some tips from a local mom on how best to prepare for and execute your adventure.

Seattle Southside mom, Meilee, bundled up her four year old and hit the road and this is what she learned:

The drive is easy freeway driving for approx. 90 minutes each way (from Seattle Southside). For lightest traffic plan on arriving at the fields early in the day on the weekends or travel during non-rush hours mid-week.
Stop at the Tulip Festival Administration office 311 W. Kincaid St. Mount Vernon, WA 98273 for free maps, advice on where to start/stop your excursion and special event info.
With maps and “Tulip Route” signage the fields are easy to find.
Wear practical shoes. There aren’t sidewalks in the fields; be prepared for dusty to muddy conditions. My daughter wore her pink polka dot rain boots for fashion and the practicality purposes.
Walking paths are made out of firmly packed gravel or dirt. Check weather forecasts to get an idea on stroller friendly conditions.
There are multiple tulip farms to see and each is immense. For families with young children I recommend pacing yourself and expect to visit one farm maybe two. We spent two hours at one field, had dinner then drove back. It was a long five hour outing for a four year old but days later she’s still talking about the “bee-you-tee-ful flowers” and I’m still admiring a collection of charming photos.
The RoozenGaarde field has food vendors. (fair food cuisine and prices) There’s a grassy area with a few tables and room to have a picnic.
Bring cash. Some vendors accept cash and plastic – others take cash only.
There are plenty of facilities (porta-potties) at the farms. For families with babies or young toddlers, bring a blanket in the diaper bag because I didn’t see any changing areas.
No pets allowed in the tulip fields. Leave Fluffy or Fido at home.
*Bonus tip – make sure your camera has plenty of battery life you’ll have a “bazillion” photo opportunities.

item.title: Buggy Adventure in Puerto Plata
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Embark on the ultimate thrill with our "Buggy Adventure" tour in Puerto Plata!
Take control of a rugged buggy and navigate the scenic beach roads and winding river, all at an equal price for couples or friends. Feel the adrenaline as you drive through the sandy shores and splash through the refreshing river waters. Whether with your significant other or a group of friends, the adventure is yours to share.
This tour promises an exhilarating day, blending off-road excitement with the stunning landscapes of Puerto Plata. Join us for a buggy adventure that creates lasting memories in the heart of this tropical paradise.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: 2 hour guided tour Enjoy an exciting Buggy ride Travel through local villages and rural roads Welcome - cocktail Farewell - toast Transfer to the safari
Buggy Ride Cocktail Beach River Adrenaline sport

Nothing was too much trouble Long went out of his way every day to make sure we experienced in full life in Vietnam. The trip ran like clockwork, without us feeling we were being rushed at any stage. He made it fun even when we cycled 100 k in a day taking in a very high mountain pass.
An excellent ride amongst stunning scenery, beautiful food and very friendly and welcoming people

item.title: Mega extreme adventure
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Do you have what it takes to feel and experience the beautiful nature of Puerto Plata like never before?
Try the adventurous stages of the exciting Mega Extreme excursion!
Stage 1: Exclusive direct pickup with our special Mega Tiger Trucks by our Experienced drivers and guides. On the way to our Mega Ranch, our guides will talk about the history of the surroundings of Puerto Plata.
Stage 2: Priority access to the Damajagua Waterfalls. Our guides will walk you through every step off the road, ensuring your maximum fun, safety and energy levels at all times.
Stage 3: Let's meet our beautiful trained horses at the Mega Ranch and enjoy riding like a real cowboy! With your tour guide, who will help each guest have a unique and fun ride. Get ready for incredible views! No experience in horses is necessary.
Stage 4: Get ready to climb high and hold on well, for an intense zip line! Get ready for incredible Tropical views flying from 6 professional zip lines with our experienced guides!
Stage 5 - Recover your energy by tasting the best homemade Dominican food from the hand of our exclusive Dominican chef!
Feel the Eco-Adrenaline!!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Specialized bilingual guide Round trip from the Hotel in Puerto Plata Zip line Fruits Snack Soft drinks and water Horse drive Taxes an feeds
Mega Adventures Ranch Costa Amber (Beach) Zip line Waterfall Horse drive

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Lifelong memories We were part of a group of 17 who quickly formed a close bond created entirely by the enthusiasm and generosity of our leader. Nothing was too much trouble Long went out of his way every day to make sure we experienced in full life in Vietnam. The trip ran like clockwork, without us feeling we were being rushed at any stage. He made it fun even when we cycled 100 k in a day taking in a very high mountain pass.

The customer service before departure was excellent, the organisation from start to finish was excellent, the accommodation was better than expected, the group leader was excellent, the itinerary was excellent. As a solo female traveller I felt completely comfortable with the rest of the group whether they were traveling alone, with friends or with partners. The mix of activities, geographical locations, sights, sounds, terrain and communities left you feeling like you had experienced and encountered Vietnam, its history, its people and its landscape

item.title: Mega Adrenaline & splash
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Dive into the ultimate adventure with our "Mega Adrenaline & Splash" tour in Puerto Plata!
Take control of a powerful buggy, soar through the treetops on a thrilling zipline, and discover a breathtaking waterfall where you can move and jump through the cascading waters.
It's an extreme day that blends heart-pounding excitement with the natural beauty of Puerto Plata. But that's not all – refuel with a typical lunch and savor tropical fruits, ensuring you're ready for more action.
This tour promises an adrenaline-fueled escapade, creating unforgettable memories in the midst of Puerto Plata's spectacular landscapes.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Specialized bilingual guide Round trip from the Hotel in Puerto Plata Zip line Buggy Fruits Lunch Soft drinks and water Taxes an feeds
Mega Adventures Ranch Costa Amber (Beach) Zip line Buggy

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Lifelong memories We were part of a group of 17 who quickly formed a close bond created entirely by the enthusiasm and generosity of our leader. Nothing was too much trouble Long went out of his way every day to make sure we experienced in full life in Vietnam. The trip ran like clockwork, without us feeling we were being rushed at any stage. He made it fun even when we cycled 100 k in a day taking in a very high mountain pass.

An interesting blend of Vietnam from north to south including an o/n sleeper train. The success and enjoyment of these trips is usually down to the blend of fellow travellers and team leader and this one was no different. The weather,early season, was mixed with a little more rain and cloud than hoped for but did not detract from the enjoyment but a little more sunshine would have enhanced the countryside. A read of the brochure and trip notes will give a very accurate picture of the breadth and variety of the trip. The daily riding distances are mainly governed by the fitness of the participants and their ability to cover the miles in a reasonable time and for the first time in my experience of 7 trips we were delayed by some participants who frankly were not cycling fit and I wonder if they had read and understood the pre - trip advice

We have been on a couple of cycling trips before and this one was probably the best. Tri our guide was outstanding and all our fellow cyclists were a great bunch of people. We got a real flavour of life in Vietnam. Lots of interesting food.The meals were good and plentiful. Thought we would lose weight but didn't! Good Hotels. Many highlights but a couple or so to point out,Whale Island and Hoi An, the 30km exhilarating downhill ride and cycling in city centre traffic...... great fun but leaves your heart racing. It is quite full on which leaves you wanting to spend more time in some of the places visited. The usual pattern is arrive at 5 - 6 pm, leave at 7.15 next morning. However we did find time to swim in the hotel pools. Overnight train was great fun ....all part of the adventure. To cover the length of the country there are some longish times in the bus but the bus was comfortable but great chance to talk with your fellow travellers. This also gives you time to see more of the country and people watch. Staggered us how much could be piled on a scooter!The bikes were ideal for the road conditions as well as being clean and very well maintained. At the frequent refreshment/rest stops there was lots of juice, water, fruit, nuts and biscuits. The driver and bike mechanic were very friendly and very competent. Great organization, things happened when Tri said they would.

item.title: Aquatic adventure in the Dolphin Park, Puerto Plata.
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded: Embark on an unforgettable experience with our "Dolphin Adventure in Puerto Plata" tour. Immerse yourself in the crystal clear waters and share magical moments with these fascinating marine beings. A unique opportunity to interact and learn about dolphins, providing joy and unforgettable memories on the beautiful coast of Puerto Plata. Walk through the tropical forest where you can interact with love birds, see fish and iguanas.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Entrance fees Lunch and refreshments Day Pass Taxes and rates Beach chairs and umbrella
See dolphin show Sea lions and birds Snorkeling in the fish aquarium Use of beach and pool Slides Walk through the tropical forest Interact with love birds See fish and iguanas

a:4:{i:0;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:26:"ENCOUNTER WITH THE DOLPHIN";s:10:"extra_name";s:26:"ENCOUNTER WITH THE DOLPHIN";s:16:"extra_max_number";s:3:"100";s:11:"extra_price";s:2:"51";s:14:"extra_required";s:3:"off";}i:2;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:21:"SWIM WITH THE DOLPHIN";s:10:"extra_name";s:21:"SWIM WITH THE DOLPHIN";s:16:"extra_max_number";s:3:"100";s:11:"extra_price";s:3:"120";s:14:"extra_required";s:3:"off";}i:3;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:25:"VIP SWIM WITH THE DOLPHIN";s:10:"extra_name";s:25:"VIP SWIM WITH THE DOLPHIN";s:16:"extra_max_number";s:3:"100";s:11:"extra_price";s:3:"171";s:14:"extra_required";s:3:"off";}i:4;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:34:"ENCOUNTER WITH SEA LIONS OR SHARKS";s:10:"extra_name";s:34:"ENCOUNTER WITH SEA LIONS OR SHARKS";s:16:"extra_max_number";s:3:"100";s:11:"extra_price";s:2:"41";s:14:"extra_required";s:3:"off";}}

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I am a little late in posting a review. We returned from this trip in early March, right when everything started to close down due to Covid-19. I can tell you that the memories of this trip have kept me going while sheltering in place. If you are thinking this might be the trip for you, please know that it is very fast paced with moving from place to place almost every night was quite challenging. The cycling itself was challenging based on ones fitness level. My husband completed every kilometer, while I did about three-quarters of the cycling. A lot of it depends on the heat, but for a female in my early 50s, I found it very doable. We had the most fabulous guide and crew. I cannot say enough of about our guide Son - he was absolutely amazing - taking care of all the details while we enjoyed ourselves. There are plenty of water/snack stops with fresh fruit and amazing snacks (ginger/nuts/cookies). They take very good care of you.

This was an amazing trip. Totally fell in love with Vietnam, We did so much in such in two weeks. The cycling, somehow. only felt like a small part of the experience as there were so many other things that we did. Each day was full on, exceptionally well organised, great food, etc Been on a few cycle trips, and I think this was the best one so far.

Another exciting adventure with this tour company. Our trip was at the end of April/beginning of May and it was very hot !!!! I'm told June/July is even hotter. Phew !!!!Despite this I loved every minute of it.It was a very busy trip but extremely well organised. I very much liked the additional drink stops as it was so very hot. Home made chilled lime was just the thing. I also very much liked Lam pre-booking the meals and us all going together. He found some wonderful places and we had delicious fresh food. There just isn't time to find somewhere yourself. This really worked well.We were lucky to be with a super group of people. Everyone happy and smiling and enjoying every moment..................well................except a few of the group who did get a bit sore. Please do get yourself some chamois butter and padded pants. It works a treat.It worked well having all the cycling in the beginning. The train was much better than I had expected and I slept like a log !!! Whale Island and Halong Bay were real treats and I would have loved more time there. But, overall, the trip was perfect for timing as it kept us within the 15 day Visa limit and we saw and did so much. Despite being informed in writing by the tour operator that our big holdalls/suitcase stays with us all the time......this was not the case. You do need to have a rucksack or flat pack bag big enough for the one and two night stays (Whale Island and Halong Bay). In fact......it works very well to just take small luggage. Much easier to do once you get your head around it.I found the cycling easy compared with other trips I've done but I do feel it is right to be called a Level 3. Everyone cycles slightly differently and there is always a bit of a mix of abilities........which makes for a good group cycle I think.

item.title: Horseback riding, buggies and zipline in Puerto Plata
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Experience the thrill of our Horseback Riding, Buggies, and Zipline Tour in Puerto Plata! Ride majestic horses, drive adventurous buggies, and soar on exhilarating ziplines. Immerse yourself in the beauty of Puerto Plata while enjoying these exciting activities, creating lasting memories of a dynamic and adventurous journey.
This tour guarantees an extreme adventure, offering the perfect blend of thrills and the beauty of Puerto Plata.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Round trip from the Hotel Zipline Fruits Horseback Riding Soft drinks and water Snack Multilingual Guide.
Mega Adventures Ranch Horse Riding Zip line (6 line) Fruits Adventure

item.title: Guided bike tour in Puerto Plata
item.dc:creator: Irosario@

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Street of the umbrellas, Callejón de doña Blanca (pink street), Independece park, Amber Museum, Fire Station, Street of the Chichiguas, Malecón de Puerto Plata, Puntilla de Puerto Plata
Bicycle with protective helmet Tour guide Water bottle Museum entrance Round trip transportation Taxes and rates

Get to know the historic center of Puerto Plata by bicycle Start with the colorful parasol Vibrant pink alley in honor of the founder of the first hotel in the city Independencia Park where you can see the Victorian-style houses and the Cathedral of San Felipe Apóstol... Famous Museum that was the setting for the movie Jurassic Park Central Fire Station and connect with the colorful street of murals and chichiguas Puerto Plata Cigar where you will learn about Dominican Tobacco and Coffee. Walking through the tropical streets you can connect to the Puerto Plata boardwalk Surrounded by the Atlantic Ocean and adorned with beautiful palm trees Puntilla of Puerto Plata where the San Felipe Fortress is located

item.title: Mega adrenaline on the beach
item.dc:creator: Irosario@
item.content:encoded:
Embark on the ultimate thrill-seeker's paradise with our "Mega Adrenaline on the Beach" tour in Puerto Plata!
Experience the rush as you take control of powerful buggies, conquer the skies on a thrilling zipline adventure, and unwind on a picturesque beach.
It's the perfect recipe for an extreme day, combining heart-pounding activities with the serene beauty of Puerto Plata. But that's not all – indulge in a typical lunch and savor tropical fruits, ensuring you refuel for more excitement.
This tour promises an adrenaline-fueled escapade coupled with the laid-back charm of the Caribbean, making it a must for adventure enthusiasts seeking the ultimate experience.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Specialized bilingual guide Round trip from the Hotel in Puerto Plata Zip line Buggy Fruits Soft drinks and water Taxes an feeds
Mega Adventures Ranch Costa Amber (Beach) Zip line Buggy

item.title: Countryside Buggy Trail in a Ocean Outpost
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Prefer to sample just a taste of tropical fun and adventure?
Choose something known or something new at Chukka’s Ocean Outpost, the number one place where thrill seekers come to play.
Your Ocean Single pass gives you access to Puerto Plata’s only seaside nature-adventure park, which features heart stopping adventure tours, as well as numerous chill-out and leisure areas where you can relax and catch your breath. Enjoy select non-motorized watersports and your choice of one Ocean Outpost tour.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Specialized bilingual guide Round trip from the Hotel in Puerto Plata (specific days) Countryside Buggy Trail Snack Soft drinks and water Entrance to the Ocean Outpost Taxes an feeds
Lockers and footwear are available to rent. Beverages available for purchase at our Restaurant & Bar
Countryside Buggy Trail Typical Lunch Ocean Outpost Tours Private Beach Watersports

a:2:{i:0;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:12:"Restrictions";s:4:"desc";s:452:"BUGGY
- Minimum age 12 years (passengers) - Drivers 18 years old with a current driver's license (No exception) - Maximum weight 265lbs/120kg. - 2 people per Buggy - Pregnant women are not allowed. - Not accessible for wheelchairs. - People with neck and back problems are not allowed. - People under the influence of drugs or alcohol will not be allowed to participate. - Clients must wear closed shoes. - All clients must sign the Waiver.";}i:1;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:36:"Schedules, free transfer on the tour";s:4:"desc";s:140:"To consult the transfers you must write to the email irosario@elvistours.info to find out the pick-up times available within the tour price.";}}

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Fantastic Trip I am a little late in posting a review. We returned from this trip in early March, right when everything started to close down due to Covid-19. I can tell you that the memories of this trip have kept me going while sheltering in place. If you are thinking this might be the trip for you, please know that it is very fast paced with moving from place to place almost every night was quite challenging. The cycling itself was challenging based on ones fitness level. My husband completed every kilometer, while I did about three-quarters of the cycling. A lot of it depends on the heat, but for a female in my early 50s, I found it very doable. We had the most fabulous guide and crew. I cannot say enough of about our guide Son - he was absolutely amazing - taking care of all the details while we enjoyed ourselves. There are plenty of water/snack stops with fresh fruit and amazing snacks (ginger/nuts/cookies). They take very good care of you.

This was an amazing trip. Totally fell in love with Vietnam, We did so much in such in two weeks. The cycling, somehow. only felt like a small part of the experience as there were so many other things that we did. Each day was full on, exceptionally well organised, great food, etc Been on a few cycle trips, and I think this was the best one so far

We were part of a group of 17 who quickly formed a close bond created entirely by the enthusiasm and generosity of our leader. Nothing was too much trouble Long went out of his way every day to make sure we experienced in full life in Vietnam. The trip ran like clockwork, without us feeling we were being rushed at any stage. He made it fun even when we cycled 100 k in a day taking in a very high mountain pass.

item.title: Over The Ocean Zipline in Puerto Plata
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Prefer to sample just a taste of tropical fun and adventure?
Your Ocean Single pass gives you access to Puerto Plata’s only seaside nature-adventure park, which features heart stopping adventure tours, as well as numerous chill-out and leisure areas where you can relax and catch your breath. Enjoy select non-motorized watersports and your choice of one Ocean Outpost tour.
Embark on a thrilling adventure with our "Over The Ocean Zipline" tour in Puerto Plata! Soar over the azure waters on a zipline, reveling in breathtaking views of the ocean.
Arrive at our ocean outpost, where non-motorized water games await your enjoyment. Whether with your significant other or a group of friends, the experience comes at an inclusive price.
Dive into an unforgettable day, combining the excitement of ziplining with the refreshing allure of the ocean.
Join us for a unique expedition that promises both adrenaline-fueled fun and relaxation, creating cherished memories against the backdrop of Puerto Plata's scenic coastal beauty.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Specialized bilingual guide Round trip from the Hotel in Puerto Plata (specific days) Zipline on the beach Lunch Soft drinks and water Entrance to the Ocean Outpost Taxes an feeds
Zipline on the beach Typical Lunch Ocean Outpost Water Sports

a:2:{i:0;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:12:"Restrictions";s:4:"desc";s:492:"ZIP LINE
- Minimum age 8 years. - Minimum height 140 cm / 4 feet and 4 inches - Maximum Weight 265lbs/120kg. - Pregnant women are not allowed. - Not accessible for wheelchairs. - People with neck and back problems are not allowed. - People under the influence of drugs or alcohol will not be allowed to participate. - Blouses that show the abdominal area are not allowed. - Customers must wear shorts 3 inches from the knees - Closed footwear. - All clients must sign the Waiver.";}i:1;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:36:"Schedules, free transfer on the tour";s:4:"desc";s:140:"To consult the transfers you must write to the email irosario@elvistours.info to find out the pick-up times available within the tour price.";}}

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Fantastic Trip I am a little late in posting a review. We returned from this trip in early March, right when everything started to close down due to Covid-19. I can tell you that the memories of this trip have kept me going while sheltering in place. If you are thinking this might be the trip for you, please know that it is very fast paced with moving from place to place almost every night was quite challenging. The cycling itself was challenging based on ones fitness level. My husband completed every kilometer, while I did about three-quarters of the cycling. A lot of it depends on the heat, but for a female in my early 50s, I found it very doable. We had the most fabulous guide and crew. I cannot say enough of about our guide Son - he was absolutely amazing - taking care of all the details while we enjoyed ourselves. There are plenty of water/snack stops with fresh fruit and amazing snacks (ginger/nuts/cookies). They take very good care of you.

An interesting blend of Vietnam from north to south including an o/n sleeper train. The success and enjoyment of these trips is usually down to the blend of fellow travellers and team leader and this one was no different. The weather,early season, was mixed with a little more rain and cloud than hoped for but did not detract from the enjoyment but a little more sunshine would have enhanced the countryside. A read of the brochure and trip notes will give a very accurate picture of the breadth and variety of the trip. The daily riding distances are mainly governed by the fitness of the participants and their ability to cover the miles in a reasonable time and for the first time in my experience of 7 trips we were delayed by some participants who frankly were not cycling fit and I wonder if they had read and understood the pre - trip advice!

We were part of a group of 17 who quickly formed a close bond created entirely by the enthusiasm and generosity of our leader. Nothing was too much trouble Long went out of his way every day to make sure we experienced in full life in Vietnam. The trip ran like clockwork, without us feeling we were being rushed at any stage. He made it fun even when we cycled 100 k in a day taking in a very high mountain pass.

item.title: ATV Adventure in the best Ocean Outpost
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Prefer to sample just a taste of tropical fun and adventure?
Choose something known or something new at Chukka’s Ocean Outpost, the number one place where thrill seekers come to play.
Your Ocean Single pass gives you access to Puerto Plata’s only seaside nature-adventure park, which features heart stopping adventure tours, as well as numerous chill-out and leisure areas where you can relax and catch your breath. Enjoy select non-motorized watersports and your choice of one Ocean Outpost tour.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Specialized bilingual guide Round trip from the Hotel in Puerto Plata (specific days) ATV Adventure Lunch Soft drinks and water Entrance to the Ocean Outpost Taxes an feeds
ATV Adventure Typical Lunch Ocean Outpost Water Sports

a:2:{i:1;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:12:"Restrictions";s:4:"desc";s:416:"ATV - Minimum age 16 years. - With a driver's license up to date (No exception) - Maximum weight 300lbs/136kg. - 1 person per ATV - Pregnant women are not allowed. - Not accessible for wheelchairs. - People with neck and back problems are not allowed. - People under the influence of drugs or alcohol will not be allowed to participate. - Clients must wear closed shoes. - All clients must sign the Waiver.";}i:2;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:36:"Schedules, free transfer on the tour";s:4:"desc";s:140:"To consult the transfers you must write to the email irosario@elvistours.info to find out the pick-up times available within the tour price.";}}

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Amazing country, beautifully seen from the seat of a bicycle. So many unusual sights - friendly people (attractive, relaxed, smiling, shouting hello); fields of rice, coffee, rubber, eucalyptus, dragon fruit, etc., farmers herding brown cows and water buffalo; basic living conditions, cooking, eating and washing-up in the open, spilling out onto pavement; scooters everywhere and crazy driving but it seems to work, no road rage; great respect for older people and ancestors (colourful cemeteries and every house has small ancestral shrine). Came back with a real feel for the country, wanting to learn more.

The customer service before departure was excellent, the organisation from start to finish was excellent, the accommodation was better than expected, the group leader was excellent, the itinerary was excellent. As a solo female traveler I felt completely comfortable with the rest of the group whether they were traveling alone, with friends or with partners. The mix of activities, geographical locations, sights, sounds, terrain and communities left you feeling like you had experienced and encountered Vietnam, its history, its people and its landscape

Another exciting adventure with this tour company. Our trip was at the end of April/beginning of May and it was very hot !!!! I'm told June/July is even hotter. Phew !!!!Despite this I loved every minute of it.It was a very busy trip but extremely well organised. I very much liked the additional drink stops as it was so very hot. Home made chilled lime was just the thing. I also very much liked Lam pre-booking the meals and us all going together. He found some wonderful places and we had delicious fresh food. There just isn't time to find somewhere yourself. This really worked well.We were lucky to be with a super group of people. Everyone happy and smiling and enjoying every moment..................well................except a few of the group who did get a bit sore. Please do get yourself some chamois butter and padded pants. It works a treat.It worked well having all the cycling in the beginning. The train was much better than I had expected and I slept like a log !!! Whale Island and Halong Bay were real treats and I would have loved more time there. But, overall, the trip was perfect for timing as it kept us within the 15 day Visa limit and we saw and did so much.Despite being informed in writing by the tour operator that our big holdalls/suitcase stays with us all the time......this was not the case. You do need to have a rucksack or flat pack bag big enough for the one and two night stays (Whale Island and Halong Bay). In fact......it works very well to just take small luggage. Much easier to do once you get your head around it.I found the cycling easy compared with other trips I've done but I do feel it is right to be called a Level 3. Everyone cycles slightly differently and there is always a bit of a mix of abilities........which makes for a good group cycle I think.

item.title: Travel to the Cayo like a V.I.P.
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Experience the epitome of luxury with our "Isla Paraíso" VIP tour, where exclusivity meets adventure in Puerto Plata.
Sail on a catamaran, indulging in the serene beauty of the ocean. Dive into the crystal-clear waters for an unforgettable diving experience and marvel at vibrant marine life while snorkeling.
Cruise on a boat, exploring the coastal wonders of Puerto Plata. This VIP tour promises relaxation and excitement, providing an elite escape.
Unwind with a delectable typical lunch and relish tropical fruits, ensuring a perfect blend of leisure and indulgence.
Join us for a day of VIP treatment amidst the breathtaking paradise of Isla Paraíso.

item.title: Travel to Cayo Levantado
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Indulge in the tranquility of our "Isla Paraíso" tour, where relaxation meets adventure in Puerto Plata.
Immerse yourself in the vibrant underwater world with a diving experience and marvel at colorful fish while snorkeling.
Cruise on a boat, soaking in the coastal beauty of Puerto Plata. This tour promises both serenity and excitement, allowing you to unwind in paradise.
Recharge with a delightful typical lunch and savor tropical fruits, ensuring a perfect blend of leisure and exploration.
Join us for a day where the soothing rhythms of the ocean and the thrill of aquatic discovery combine, creating an unforgettable island escape.

item.title: Classic Car City Tour, Puerto Plata
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded:
Explore Puerto Plata in style with our Classic Cars City Tour. Immerse yourself in the charm of the city center as you cruise in vintage cars. Discover the vibrant culture and rich history of Puerto Plata, creating timeless memories as you navigate the streets in these classic beauties.
Cars brands Buik, Dodge, Ford, Chrysler y Plymouth
The price includes 4 people in the same vehicle

Malecon of Puerto Plata Visit Ron Macorix House Museum Visit Museum Tour Umbrella Street, where you will enjoy “Yun Yun” bar 1920, a walk along pink street "Callejon Doña Blanca" Independece Park Kiet Street San felipe fortress
a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:39:"How many people does the price include?";s:4:"desc";s:48:"The price includes 4 people in the same vehicle.";}}

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: An interesting blend of Vietnam from north to south including an o/n sleeper train. The success and enjoyment of these trips is usually down to the blend of fellow travellers and team leader and this one was no different. The weather,early season, was mixed with a little more rain and cloud than hoped for but did not detract from the enjoyment but a little more sunshine would have enhanced the countryside. A read of the brochure and trip notes will give a very accurate picture of the breadth and variety of the trip. The daily riding distances are mainly governed by the fitness of the participants and their ability to cover the miles in a reasonable time and for the first time in my experience of 7 trips we were delayed by some participants who frankly were not cycling fit and I wonder if they had read and understood the pre - trip advice!

We have been on a couple of cycling trips before and this one was probably the best. Tri our guide was outstanding and all our fellow cyclists were a great bunch of people. We got a real flavour of life in Vietnam. Lots of interesting food.The meals were good and plentiful. Thought we would lose weight but didn't! Good Hotels. Many highlights but a couple or so to point out,Whale Island and Hoi An, the 30km exhilarating downhill ride and cycling in city centre traffic...... great fun but leaves your heart racing. It is quite full on which leaves you wanting to spend more time in some of the places visited. The usual pattern is arrive at 5 - 6 pm, leave at 7.15 next morning. However we did find time to swim in the hotel pools. Overnight train was great fun ....all part of the adventure. To cover the length of the country there are some longish times in the bus but the bus was comfortable but great chance to talk with your fellow travellers. This also gives you time to see more of the country and people watch. Staggered us how much could be piled on a scooter!The bikes were ideal for the road conditions as well as being clean and very well maintained. At the frequent refreshment/rest stops there was lots of juice, water, fruit, nuts and biscuits. The driver and bike mechanic were very friendly and very competent. Great organization, things happened when Tri said they would.

I am a little late in posting a review. We returned from this trip in early March, right when everything started to close down due to Covid-19. I can tell you that the memories of this trip have kept me going while sheltering in place. If you are thinking this might be the trip for you, please know that it is very fast paced with moving from place to place almost every night was quite challenging. The cycling itself was challenging based on ones fitness level. My husband completed every kilometer, while I did about three-quarters of the cycling. A lot of it depends on the heat, but for a female in my early 50s, I found it very doable. We had the most fabulous guide and crew. I cannot say enough of about our guide Son - he was absolutely amazing - taking care of all the details while we enjoyed ourselves. There are plenty of water/snack stops with fresh fruit and amazing snacks (ginger/nuts/cookies). They take very good care of you.

item.title: City Tour Teleferico Puerto Plata
item.dc:creator: superadmin
item.content:encoded: We invite you to discover the essence of Puerto Plata through our exciting City Tour and Cable Car. Explore the most picturesque corners of the city, immerse yourself in local culture and enjoy panoramic views from the Cable Car. From vibrant history to natural beauty, our Puerto Plata Cable Car City Tour offers a complete experience. Join us to explore the hidden treasures of this Caribbean gem and create unforgettable memories. We will visit charming places with mansions and neoclassical and Victorian buildings, full of elegance and color. In addition, we will explore the Puerto Plata Cable Car, the Amber Museum, the Macorix Rum Museum, the Historic Center, Calle de las Sombrillas, Paseo de Doña Blanca, Paseo Melosa and Calle de las Chichiguas, as well as the imposing San Felipe Fortress. Get ready for a unique adventure!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Specialized bilingual guide Private transport Entrance fees Lunch and refreshments
Puerto Plata cable car. Amber Museum Macorix Rum Museum Historic Center of Puerto Plata Umbrella Street Dona Blanca's Walk Melosa Walk and the Street Chichiguas Street. San Felipe Fortress

Groups / Conference bookings: + In case there is any no-show or cancellation/amendment of the conference/group (in part or full), within 15 days or less from the date of check in, a retention charge will be levied. + The retention charge will be calculated as follows - Number of rooms being canceled/no-shows X 1 night X applicable daily rate per room for the conference/group. + In case of Early check out retention will be charged for those nights booked, now being released due to the early check out.

item.title: Discover Constanza, Monument to the Divine Child+Aguas Blancas waterfall+Abandoned house+Las Piramides
item.dc:creator: Irosario@
item.content:encoded:
Explore the hidden gems of Constanza, Dominican Republic, with our thrilling tour.
Discover Valle Nuevo's mystical pyramids, the mysterious abandoned house, and the breathtaking Aguas Blancas waterfall—all from the comfort of our safari truck.
Cap off your adventure with a mouthwatering Typical lunch, immersing yourself in the local flavors.
Join us for an unforgettable experience!

Embark on a captivating journey with our Constanza tour in the Dominican Republic.
Witness the awe-inspiring Aguas Blancas waterfall and the enchanting Monument to the Divine Child, boasting a stunning view of the Constanza Valley.
Indulge in a delectable Creole lunch aboard our safari truck for an unforgettable experience.

item.title: Discover Constanza, know the valley
item.dc:creator: Irosario@
item.content:encoded:
Embark on an exhilarating adventure with our Constanza tour in the Dominican Republic.
Traverse the picturesque valley aboard our safari truck, immersing yourself in the breathtaking landscapes and local culture.
Revel in the charm of Constanza as you indulge in a delectable Creole lunch, savoring the authentic flavors of the region.
Join us for an unforgettable experience, blending scenic exploration and culinary delight in the heart of the Dominican beauty.

item.title: Discover Constanza, Monument to the Divine Child+Lettered stone
item.dc:creator: Irosario@
item.content:encoded:
Embark on a mesmerizing journey with our Constanza tour in the Dominican Republic.
Discover the Monument to the Divine Child, offering a breathtaking view of Constanza Valley.
Uncover the secrets of the mysterious "Piedra Letrada" and immerse yourself in its enigmatic allure. Indulge in a delightful Creole lunch while cruising through the landscapes in our safari truck.
Join us for an unforgettable adventure blending culture, nature, and delicious cuisine in the heart of the Dominican Republic.
